stanza.line: My glass shall not persuade me I amold
So long as youth and thou are of one date
But when in thee time furrows Ibehold
Then look I death my days should expiate
For all that beauty that doth coverthee
Is but the seemly raiment of myheart
Which in thy breast doth live as thine inme
How can I then be elder than thouart
O therefore love be of thyself sowary
As I not for my self but for theewill
Bearing thy heart which I will keep sochary
As tender nurse her babe from faringill
Presume not on thy heart when mine isslain
Thou gav me thine not to give backagain
